milestones.title: Sprint 2: Complete Scoring
milestones.description: Finish trust scoring, audit export, begin council

issues.title: [E1] Trust Component Type Definitions
issues.body:
## Description
As a developer, I need TypeScript interfaces for the enhanced trust scoring system so that all components have consistent type safety.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `TrustComponents` interface defines all 5 component scores
- [ ] `ComponentScore` interface includes raw, weighted, samples, confidence, lastUpdated
- [ ] `EnhancedTrustScore` extends existing `TrustScore` with new fields
- [ ] `TrustTier` type maps score ranges to tier names
- [ ] All types exported from `src/core/types/trust.ts`
- [ ] JSDoc comments on all interfaces

## Files
- CREATE: `src/core/types/trust.ts`
- MODIFY: `src/types.ts`

## Story Points: 2

issues.title: [E1] Decision Accuracy Calculator
issues.body:
## Description
As the trust system, I need to calculate decision accuracy from task approval rates so that agent performance is measured objectively.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Query task history for specified agent (configurable lookback, default 90 days)
- [ ] Calculate raw approval rate: approved / total
- [ ] Apply risk-adjusted weighting (low=1x, medium=1.5x, high=2x, critical=3x)
- [ ] Return `ComponentScore` with confidence based on sample size
- [ ] Handle edge case: new agent with 0 tasks returns 50 (neutral)
- [ ] Confidence reaches 1.0 at 100+ samples

## Files
- CREATE: `src/core/TrustScoreCalculator.ts`
- CREATE: `src/core/TrustScoreCalculator.test.ts`

## Story Points: 3

issues.title: [E1] Ethics Compliance Calculator
issues.body:
## Description
As the trust system, I need to calculate ethics compliance from violations and escalations so that behavioral issues reduce trust.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Query violations for agent (90-day window)
- [ ] Query escalations for agent (90-day window)
- [ ] Start at 100, deduct 10 per violation, 5 per escalation
- [ ] Floor at 0 (no negative scores)
- [ ] Return `ComponentScore` with confidence = 1
- [ ] Integrate with existing `SecurityLayer.getAuditLog()`

## Files
- MODIFY: `src/core/TrustScoreCalculator.ts`

## Story Points: 2

issues.title: [E1] Task Success Calculator
issues.body:
## Description
As the trust system, I need to calculate task success rate from completed vs failed tasks so that reliability is measured.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Query completed tasks for agent (90-day window)
- [ ] Query failed tasks for agent (90-day window)
- [ ] Calculate: (completed / (completed + failed)) * 100
- [ ] Handle edge case: 0 tasks returns 50 (neutral)
- [ ] Return `ComponentScore` with confidence based on sample size
- [ ] Use existing task data from `PersistenceLayer`

## Files
- MODIFY: `src/core/TrustScoreCalculator.ts`

## Story Points: 2

issues.title: [E1] Operational Stability Calculator
issues.body:
## Description
As the trust system, I need to calculate operational stability from error rates and response times so that system health is tracked.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Query error count for agent (90-day window)
- [ ] Query average response time for agent
- [ ] Error penalty: -5 per error (max -50)
- [ ] Response time penalty: -1 per 100ms above 500ms baseline
- [ ] Start at 100, apply penalties, floor at 0
- [ ] Return `ComponentScore` with appropriate confidence

issues.title: [E1] Weighted Score Aggregation
issues.body:
## Description
As the trust system, I need to aggregate component scores with proper weighting so that the final FICO-style score is calculated.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Apply weights: accuracy=35%, ethics=25%, tasks=20%, stability=15%, peers=5%
- [ ] Calculate weighted sum of component scores
- [ ] Scale to 300-1000 range (FICO-style)
- [ ] Apply inheritance bonus (80% of parent)
- [ ] Apply penalty deductions
- [ ] Clamp final score to 300-1000
- [ ] Derive tier from final score
- [ ] Calculate 7-day trend

issues.title: [E2] Hash Computation Module
issues.body:
## Description
As the audit system, I need a reliable hash computation module so that audit entries are cryptographically secured.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Use Node.js `crypto.createHash('sha256')`
- [ ] Compute hash from deterministic JSON string
- [ ] Exclude `entryHash` field from computation
- [ ] Handle Date serialization consistently (ISO string)
- [ ] Handle undefined/null values consistently
- [ ] Return lowercase hex string (64 characters)

## Files
- CREATE: `src/core/CryptographicAuditLogger.ts`
- CREATE: `src/core/CryptographicAuditLogger.test.ts`

## Story Points: 2

issues.title: [E2] Chain-Linked Entry Logging
issues.body:
## Description
As the audit system, I need to create chain-linked audit entries so that the audit trail is tamper-evident.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] First entry uses `previousHash = 'GENESIS'`
- [ ] Each subsequent entry uses previous entry's `entryHash`
- [ ] Increment `sequenceNumber` monotonically
- [ ] Compute and store `entryHash` for current entry
- [ ] Persist entry immediately (append-only)
- [ ] Return complete `CryptographicAuditEntry`
- [ ] Emit `audit:entry-created` event

## Files
- MODIFY: `src/core/CryptographicAuditLogger.ts`

## Story Points: 2

issues.title: [E2] Chain Verification
issues.body:
## Description
As a compliance officer, I need to verify the audit chain integrity so that I can prove the log hasn't been tampered with.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Verify chain from any start sequence to any end sequence
- [ ] Check each entry's `previousHash` matches previous `entryHash`
- [ ] Recompute each entry's hash and compare to stored
- [ ] Return `AuditChainStatus` with success/failure details
- [ ] On failure, identify exact sequence number
- [ ] Describe what was wrong (missing, mismatch, tampered)
- [ ] Handle missing entries gracefully

## Files
- MODIFY: `src/core/CryptographicAuditLogger.ts`

## Story Points: 2
